intro: Berkheyopsis brevisquama, commonly known as the short-sheath Berkheyopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it is adapted to survive in dry conditions with minimal water requirements. Its unique morphology and ecological resilience make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
